standardized the formatting of numbers, removed spaces before and after en-dashes and em-dashes
changed some hypens to en-dashes or em-dashes
/* Death squads (1941-1943) */ changed hypen to en-dash
Edited number of Roma victims in line with discussion
The cited sources support this version; please don't introduce [[WP:OR|your own interpretation]] of sources
Fixed small error - The SS ''Planned'' and ''Executed'' the euthanasia under the leadership of Himmler. Hitler may have expressed some anti-jewish sentiment, but he didn't direct the euthanasia.
Edited reference to more accurately represent Milton's conclusion.
A museum pamphlet does not necessarily indicate current opinion. Please read sources provided which review the original research.
on the contrary, your phrasing gives undue prominence to a minority POV; please read the sources provided
"up to half a million" more accurately represents both predominant POVs.
This was not "fixing" the lead, it was giving undue prominance to one POV. This version is more balanced.
no need to keep repeating "the Nazi regime"
fixed lead again; please read the sources
Regime has negative impact. It wasn't culture it was ideology which emphasized traditional German culture. The NSDAP was a party, which became government. Legally, voted in by the way
rv bizarre claim that the term "regime" is somehow POV. It accurately reflects the fact that Nazism was more than just "the government" but a whole culture
Numbers to text. Changed "perhaps" to "up to" to reflect its status as more than a fanciful guess.
Neutrality, we can't run around calling everything a regime.
Slight edit for better flow, while retaining neutrality.
many include and many do not; but the former is less negative given the following sentence
/* Who knew about the killings? */ removed non-English; maybe someone can decipher it
/* Norway */ removed bla that isn't English anyway
changing 'slaughtered' to 'killed' appropriately reflects the remarks of Primo Levi and is less editorial
/* Victims */ changing 'slaughtered' to 'killed' appropriately reflects the remarks of Primo Levi and is less editorial
/* Death toll */ Corrected numbers for Roma victims. I need to link to the same reference I used in the introduction, anyone help?
/* Etymology and usage of the term */ this sentence does not make sense, and the article referred to does not discuss what the sentence appears to be trying to say
it's not for us to say that his argument is "convincing"; tweak for NPOV and to indicate that it's not just "only Jews" or "everyone".
Added reference for Roma victims of Holocaust.
220,000 Roma was a 1999 estimate by Sybil Milton, who explicitly stated it was a conservative estimate and the real number is likely to be closer to 500,000. Other sources argue for a higher figure.
/* Legal proceedings against Nazis */ citation on the outlawries of Klaus Barbie
